page.title: 08NEW INOVATIONS IN FARMING
page.content: During the last 10 yrs.vast increases in yield potential of corn crops have been achieved, brought about by{plant {breeders}improving varities,by the use of{pesticides}& {fungicides}for the control of pests and diseases, and weed control with{herbicides.}2-3 tonnes per acre of wheat & barley are obtained but at a cost of Â£100 per ac. on sprays. Most farmers own a sprayer. Tractors of 50-100hp are used on this land. Sugarbeet is now lifted by 2-3 row machines. Combine harvesters cut corn in 10-12ft. widths. Straw is often baled into large rounds of 4-6ft Carrots are grown with a covering of polythene sheet in the early stages to produce crops 4 weeks earlier than those uncovered.
